topics.body:
So playing CK2 as the Emperor (Samrat) of Rajastan I was forced to deal with a faction that wanted my brother in power over me and I had no real way to diplomacy my way around them. So while I was fighting with the Jianists to the south they decided to force me to abdicate. I thought I picked the option to fight them, but when I look around I found the only other war I was involved in was a Holy War for Baluchistan, apparently started by my brother in question. As to be imagined, I was mighty confused.
 
But then I realized I was now longer Samrat, but a Raj myself. Evidently I picked the option to voluntarily abdicate from the title of Samrat. So with the war I started almost finished I shrugged it off, won that, and was content I was still a Raj, and not the Hindu equivalent of a count.
 
Anyways, some time later there was put into play a faction to force my brother off the throne and re-instate me as the Samrat of Rajastan. They informed me - as they should - and I waited for the fireworks.
 
Samrat Artemis dully abdicated the throne with no fuss to allow the Second Reign of Samrat Big Macintosh. By Siva they know who rules. Shortly afterwards I think he died because he wasn't ruling as the Raj of Sindh, his son was.
topics.author: 4fe4bf947f123b175b000001

I actually like the mythos of Naruto conceptually: various families with genetic diseases which effect their jutsu, warring conglomerates who fight for money.
